     Title                Strange nevvs from west-Smithfield [sic] or, The man-child of Manchester: being a true and impartial account of the prodigious knowledge and elocution of a male-infant, of three years of age, newly brought up to the Bear-Inn in Smithfield; who at his first speaking, corrected his father as he was reading in the Bible, and at the same time discovered his ability to discourse in Latine, Greek, and Hebrew, together with his desire of seeing his Majesty, to whom he had

     Record number :       141

     ESTC System No.      006082705

     ESTC Citation No.    R16733

     Author - personal    Le Clerc, Jean, 1657-1736.

     Uniform title        Genesis, sive Mosis prophetÃ¦ liber primus. English

     Title                Twelve dissertations out of Monsieur Le Clerk's Genesis, concerning the Hebrew tongue. Manner of interpreting the Bible. Author of the Pentateuch. Temptation of Eve by the Serpent. Flood. Confusion of languages. Original of circumcision. Divine appearances in the Old Testament. Subversion of Sodom. Pillar of salt. Coming of Shiloh. Several obscure texts in Genesis explain'd and illustrated. Done out of Latin by Mr. Brown. To which is added, a dissertation

                          concerning the Israelites passage through the Red Sea, by another hand.

     Publisher/year       London : printed and are to be sold by R. Baldwin, near the Oxford-Arms in Warwick-Lane, 1696.

     Title                The vvhole book of Psalms, collected into English metre, by Thomas Sternhold, John Hopkins, and others, conferred with the Hebrew: set forth and allowed to be sung in all churches, of all the people together, before and after morning and evening prayer, and also before and after sermons; and moreover in private houses, for their godly solace and comfort, laying apart all ungodly songs and ballads, which tend onely to the nourishing of vice, and corrupting of youth.

     Uniform title        Josippon. English. Abridgments.

     Title                The vvonderful, and most deplorable history of the latter times of the Jews, and of the city of Hierusalem. Beginning where the Holy Scriptures do end. Written first in Hebrew, and now made more methodical and corrected of sundry errors.

     Variant title        Wonderful, and most deplorable history of the latter times of the Jews

     Publisher/year       London : printed for John Stafford, and are to be sold at the George at Fleet-bridge, and by Humphrey Moseley at the Princes Arms in St. Pauls Church-yard, 1652.

     Physical descr.      [16], 432, [8] p. 4 leaves of plates : ill., port. ; 8â°.

     General note         A translation of Abraham ben David, ha-Levi's abstract, in book 3 of his "Sefer ha-Kabalah", of the anonymous "Josippon" or "Yosippon". The latter has been misattributed to a Joseph ben Gorion, usually identified with Joseph ben Gorion ha-Kohen but occasionally with Flavius Josephus.

     General note         The portrait of Josephus Ben-Gorion is signed: Iohn Stafford Excudit. Ro: Vaughan sculp:.

     General note         Annotation on Thomason copy: "June: 2".

     Citation/references  Wing (2nd ed.), J1083

     Citation/references  Thomason, E.1427[1]

     Subject              Jews -- History -- 586 B.C.-70 A.D. -- Early works to 1800.

     Subject              Jerusalem -- History -- Early works to 1800.

     ESTC System No.      006152590

     ESTC Citation No.    R186452

     Title                Whereas there is a clause in a bill brought into the Honourable House of Commons entituled, An Act for preventing frauds and regulating abuses in the plantation-trade, in these words, viz. And be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, that no alien or foreigner or any person or persons other than such as are natives of England or Ireland, or such persons as are born in His Majesties plantations in Asia, Africa or America, shall after the [blank] day of

                          [blank] exercise the trade or occupation of a merchant or factor in any of the said plantations upon pain of the forfeiture of [blank] one [blank] to His Majestie, one to the governour of the plantation, where such persons shall so offend, and the other [blank] to the person suing for the same in any of His Majesties courts in the plantation where such offence shall be committed, &c. Those of the Hebrew nation residing at London, mosy humbly crave leave to offer

                          ... some reasons why they humbly hope the Honourable House will not pass that clause; or at least that they may be exempted out of the prohibition thereby intended.

     Publisher/year       [London] : [s.n.], [1696?]

     Physical descr.      1 sheet ([1] p.) ; 1/2â° .

     General note         Title from first three paragraphs.

     General note         Wing reports title: Whereas there is a clause in a bill brought into the Hon. House of Commons entitled, an act for preventing frauds and regulating abuses in the plantation trade . . . those of the Hebrew nation residing in London.

     General note         Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.

     Record number :       177

     ESTC System No.      006162658

     ESTC Citation No.    R176530

     Uniform title        Bible. Psalms. English. Sternhold and Hopkins. 1685.

     Uniform title        Whole book of psalms

     Title                The whole book of Psalms, collected into English metre by Thomas Sternhold, John Hopkins, and others, conferred with the Hebrew: set forth and allowed to be sung in all churches, of all the people together, before and after morning and evening prayer, and also before and after sermons; and moreover in private houses for their godly solace and comfort, laying apart all ungodly songs and ballads, which tend only to the nourishing of vice, and corrupting of youth.

     Variant title        Psalter or psalms of David paraphras'd

     Publisher/year       Oxford : printed at the Theater, and are to be sold by Thomas Guy at the Oxford Arms on the west-side of the Royal Exchange in Cornhil, London, 1685.

     Physical descr.      [6], 50, [4] p. ; 4â°.

     Uncontrolled note    Item does not match entry in Wing (2nd ed., and CD-ROM, 1996), although apparently reported as B2554A from AN holdings. "The psalter or psalms of David paraphras'd, 1685" is reported as B2554A from AN holdings.

     Record number :       198

     ESTC System No.      006144797

     ESTC Citation No.    R41860

     Title                The Whole booke of Psalmes collected into English meter by Tho. Sternhold, John Hopkins, W. Whittingham and others ; conferred with the Hebrew ; with apt notes to sing them withall ; newly set forth, and allowed to be sung in all churches, of all the people together, before and after morning and evening prayer, and also before and after sermons, moreover in private houses, for their godly solace and comfort, laying apart all ungodly songs and ballads, which tend

                          only to the nourishing of vice, and corrupting of youth.

     Publisher/year       London : Printed by M.F. for the Company of Stationers, 1682.

     Physical descr.      330, [6] p. : music. 24â°.

     General note         "Cum privilegio Regis regali."

     General note         Includes index.

     General note         Imperfect: tightly bound and torn, with print show-through and some loss of print.

     General note         Format from Wing.

     Uncontrolled note    Unedited record.

     Citation/references  Wing, B2385

     Surrogates           Microfilm. Ann Arbor, Mich. : University Microfilms International, 1986. 1 microfilm reel ; 35 mm. (Early English books, 1641-1700 ; 1696:8)

     Record number :       199

     ESTC System No.      006135297

     ESTC Citation No.    R35551

     Title                The young-students-library, containing, extracts and abridgments of the most valuable books printed in England, and in the forreign journals, from the year sixty five, to this time. To which is added, a new essay upon all sorts of learning; wherein the use of the science is distinctly treated on. By the Athenian Society. Also, a large alphabetical table, comprehending the contents of this volume. And of all the Athenian Mercuries and supplements, &c. printed in the

                          year 1691.

     Variant title        Young students library

     Variant title        De punctorum origine, antiquitate & authoritate: or, A discourse concerning the antiquity, divine original and authority of the points, vowels, and accents, that are placed to the Hebrew Bible

     Variant title        Discourse concerning the antiquity, divine original and authority of the points, vowels, and accents, that are placed to the Hebrew Bible

     Publisher/year       London : printed for John Dunton, at the Raven in the Poultry. Where is to be had the intire sett of Athenian Gazettes, and the Supplements to 'em for the year, 1691. bound up all together, (with the alphabetical table to the whole year) or else in separate volumes, (or single Mercuries to this time), 1692.

     Physical descr.      [6], xviii, 240, [2], 241-289, 288-316, 321-479, [17] p., [1] leaf of plates : ill. ; 2â°.

     General note         "[Hebrew] seu, De punctorum origine, antiquitate & authoritate: or, A discourse concerning the antiquity, divine original and authority of the points, vowels, and accents, that are placed to the Hebrew Bible." has separate dated title page on leaf chi1r; pagination continues with quire 4A.

     General note         Engraved illustrated frontispiece (plate) signed: F.H. van Hove sculp.

     General note         Includes indexes (Nelson & Seccombe 21.0530).

     General note         Signatures: [superscript pi]AÂ² [superscript pi]a1 a-dÂ² e1 A-UÂ², 2A-2UÂ², 3A-3UÂ², chi1 4A-4MÂ² 4N1 4O-4UÂ² 5A-5VÂ² 6A-6UÂ² 7A-7DÂ².
